definition: to weigh down/to trouble/to implicate (sb)/tied down (by affairs)
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei

sentences.english: Children were a tie on her.
sentences.chinese: 小孩对于她是一种牵累。

sentences.english: Tom was up to his ears in that trouble last night.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆昨晚深受那桩麻烦事的牵累。

sentences.english: She says the housework is a tie .
The widow advertised herself as "without encumbrance".
sentences.chinese: 那寡妇登了告白注明“无儿女牵累”。

sentences.english: He was worried by all the cares of the family.
sentences.chinese: 他为家庭的各种牵累所烦恼。

sentences.english: He had put off all personal cares.
sentences.chinese: 他已摆脱了一切个人的牵累。

sentences.english: I left the room to forestall involvements.
sentences.chinese: 我抢先离开了这房间以免牵累。

sentences.english: At last she was freed from all encumberances.
sentences.chinese: 她终于从一切牵累中解脱出来。

sentences.english: BofA's consumer operations continue to weigh on it.
sentences.chinese: 美银的消费金融部门至今仍持续牵累整个集团。

sentences.english: The government declared the implicated diplomats persona non grata.
sentences.chinese: 政府宣布有牵累的外交官为不受欢迎的人。

definition: to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to implicate/implicated/to link together
to get sb involved in one's trouble/Taiwan pr. [dai4 lei4]
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
variant of 牽連|牵连[qian1 lian2]
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to commit a crime
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to punish
(of an official) to lose one's job
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to run into misfortune
crafty scoundrel/villain
to bully
mean treatment/indifference/meager hospitality
